title: 論語
source: Chinese Text Project (ctext.org) - James Legge translation

passages.zh: 子曰：「學而時習之，不亦說乎？
passages.en: The Master said, "Is it not pleasant to learn with a constant perseverance and application?

passages.zh: 有朋自遠方來，不亦樂乎？
passages.en: Is it not delightful to have friends coming from distant quarters?

passages.zh: 人不知而不慍，不亦君子乎？」
passages.en: Is he not a man of complete virtue, who feels no discomposure though men may take no note of him?"

passages.zh: 有子曰：「其為人也孝弟，而好犯上者，鮮矣；
passages.en: The philosopher You said, "They are few who, being filial and fraternal, are fond of offending against their superiors.

passages.zh: 不好犯上，而好作亂者，未之有也。
passages.en: There have been none, who, not liking to offend against their superiors, have been fond of stirring up confusion.

passages.zh: 君子務本，本立而道生。
passages.en: The superior man bends his attention to what is radical. That being established, all practical courses naturally grow up.

passages.zh: 孝弟也者，其為仁之本與！」
passages.en: Filial piety and fraternal submission! - are they not the root of all benevolent actions?"

passages.zh: 子曰：「巧言令色，鮮矣仁！」
passages.en: The Master said, "Fine words and an insinuating appearance are seldom associated with true virtue."

passages.zh: 曾子曰：「吾日三省吾身：為人謀而不忠乎？
passages.en: The philosopher Zeng said, "I daily examine myself on three points: whether, in transacting business for others, I may have been not faithful;

passages.zh: 與朋友交而不信乎？
passages.en: whether, in intercourse with friends, I may have been not sincere;

passages.zh: 傳不習乎？」
passages.en: whether I may have not mastered and practiced the instructions of my teacher."

passages.zh: 子曰：「道千乘之國：敬事而信，節用而愛人，使民以時。」
passages.en: The Master said, "To rule a country of a thousand chariots, there must be reverent attention to business, and sincerity; economy in expenditure, and love for men; and the employment of the people at the proper seasons."

passages.zh: 子曰：「弟子入則孝，出則弟，謹而信，汎愛眾，而親仁。
passages.en: The Master said, "A youth, when at home, should be filial, and, abroad, respectful to his elders. He should be earnest and truthful. He should overflow in love to all, and cultivate the friendship of the good.

passages.zh: 行有餘力，則以學文。」
passages.en: When he has time and opportunity, after the performance of these things, he should employ them in polite studies."

passages.zh: 子夏曰：「賢賢易色，事父母能竭其力，事君能致其身，與朋友交言而有信。
passages.en: Zi Xia said, "If a man withdraws his mind from the love of beauty, and applies it as sincerely to the love of the virtuous; if, in serving his parents, he can exert his utmost strength; if, in serving his prince, he can devote his life; if, in his intercourse with his friends, his words are sincere -

passages.zh: 雖曰未學，吾必謂之學矣。」
passages.en: although men say that he has not learned, I will certainly say that he has."

passages.zh: 子曰：「君子不重則不威，學則不固。
passages.en: The Master said, "If the scholar be not grave, he will not call forth any veneration, and his learning will not be solid.

passages.zh: 主忠信，無友不如己者，過則勿憚改。」
passages.en: Hold faithfulness and sincerity as first principles. Have no friends not equal to yourself. When you have faults, do not fear to abandon them."

passages.zh: 曾子曰：「慎終追遠，民德歸厚矣。」
passages.en: The philosopher Zeng said, "Let there be a careful attention to perform the funeral rites to parents, and let them be followed when long gone with the ceremonies of sacrifice - then the virtue of the people will resume its proper excellence."

passages.zh: 子禽問於子貢曰：「夫子至於是邦也，必聞其政，求之與？抑與之與？」
passages.en: Zi Qin asked Zi Gong, saying, "When our master comes to any country, he does not fail to learn all about its government. Does he ask his information? or is it given to him?"

passages.zh: 子貢曰：「夫子溫、良、恭、儉、讓以得之。夫子之求之也，其諸異乎人之求之與？」
passages.en: Zi Gong said, "Our master is benign, upright, courteous, temperate, and complaisant and thus he gets his information. The master's mode of asking information! - is it not different from that of other men?"

passages.zh: 子曰：「父在，觀其志；
passages.en: The Master said, "While a man's father is alive, look at the bent of his will;

passages.zh: 父沒，觀其行；
passages.en: when his father is dead, look at his conduct.

passages.zh: 三年無改於父之道，可謂孝矣。」
passages.en: If for three years he does not alter from the way of his father, he may be called filial."

passages.zh: 有子曰：「禮之用，和為貴。
passages.en: The philosopher You said, "In practicing the rules of propriety, a natural ease is to be prized.

passages.zh: 先王之道斯為美，小大由之。
passages.en: In the ways prescribed by the ancient kings, this is the excellent quality, and in things small and great we follow them.

passages.zh: 有所不行，知和而和，不以禮節之，亦不可行也。」
passages.en: Yet it is not to be observed in all cases. If one, knowing how such ease should be prized, manifests it, without regulating it by the rules of propriety, this likewise is not to be done."

passages.zh: 有子曰：「信近於義，言可復也；
passages.en: The philosopher You said, "When agreements are made according to what is right, what is spoken can be made good.

passages.zh: 恭近於禮，遠恥辱也；
passages.en: When respect is shown according to what is proper, one keeps far from shame and disgrace.

passages.zh: 因不失其親，亦可宗也。」
passages.en: When the parties upon whom a man leans are proper persons to be intimate with, he can make them his guides and masters."

passages.zh: 子曰：「君子食無求飽，居無求安，敏於事而慎於言，就有道而正焉，可謂好學也已。」
passages.en: The Master said, "He who aims to be a man of complete virtue in his food does not seek to gratify his appetite, nor in his dwelling place does he seek the appliances of ease; he is earnest in what he is doing, and careful in his speech; he frequents the company of men of principle that he may be rectified - such a person may be said indeed to love to learn."

passages.zh: 子貢曰：「貧而無諂，富而無驕，何如？」
passages.en: Zi Gong said, "What do you pronounce concerning the poor man who yet does not flatter, and the rich man who is not proud?"

passages.zh: 子曰：「可也。未若貧而樂，富而好禮者也。」
passages.en: The Master replied, "They will do; but they are not equal to him, who, though poor, is yet cheerful, and to him, who, though rich, loves the rules of propriety."

passages.zh: 子貢曰：「《詩》云：『如切如磋，如琢如磨。』其斯之謂與？」
passages.en: Zi Gong replied, "It is said in the Book of Poetry, 'As you cut and then file, as you carve and then polish.' - The meaning is the same, I apprehend, as that which you have just expressed."

passages.zh: 子曰：「賜也，始可與言詩已矣！告諸往而知來者。」
passages.en: The Master said, "With one like Ci, I can begin to talk about the odes. I told him one point, and he knew its proper sequence."

passages.zh: 子曰：「不患人之不己知，患不知人也。」
passages.en: The Master said, "I will not be afflicted at men's not knowing me; I will be afflicted that I do not know men."

passages.zh: 子曰：「為政以德，譬如北辰，居其所而眾星共之。」
passages.en: The Master said, "He who exercises government by means of his virtue may be compared to the north polar star, which keeps its place and all the stars turn towards it."

passages.zh: 子曰：「詩三百，一言以蔽之，曰『思無邪』。」
passages.en: The Master said, "In the Book of Poetry are three hundred pieces, but the design of them all may be embraced in one sentence - 'Having no depraved thoughts.'"

passages.zh: 子曰：「道之以政，齊之以刑，民免而無恥；
passages.en: The Master said, "If the people be led by laws, and uniformity sought to be given them by punishments, they will try to avoid the punishment, but have no sense of shame.

passages.zh: 道之以德，齊之以禮，有恥且格。」
passages.en: If they be led by virtue, and uniformity sought to be given them by the rules of propriety, they will have the sense of shame, and moreover will become good."

passages.zh: 子曰：「吾十有五而志于學，三十而立，四十而不惑，五十而知天命，六十而耳順，七十而從心所欲，不踰矩。」
passages.en: The Master said, "At fifteen, I had my mind bent on learning. At thirty, I stood firm. At forty, I had no doubts. At fifty, I knew the decrees of Heaven. At sixty, my ear was an obedient organ for the reception of truth. At seventy, I could follow what my heart desired, without transgressing what was right."

passages.zh: 孟懿子問孝。子曰：「無違。」
passages.en: Meng Yi asked what filial piety was. The Master said, "It is not being disobedient."

passages.zh: 樊遲御，子告之曰：「孟孫問孝於我，我對曰『無違』。」
passages.en: Soon after, as Fan Chi was driving him, the Master told him, saying, "Meng-sun asked me what filial piety was, and I answered him, - 'not being disobedient.'"

passages.zh: 樊遲曰：「何謂也？」
passages.en: Fan Chi said, "What did you mean?"

passages.zh: 子曰：「生事之以禮；死葬之以禮，祭之以禮。」
passages.en: The Master replied, "That parents, when alive, be served according to propriety; that, when dead, they should be buried according to propriety; and that they should be sacrificed to according to propriety."

passages.zh: 孟武伯問孝。子曰：「父母唯其疾之憂。」
passages.en: Meng Wu asked what filial piety was. The Master said, "Parents are anxious lest their children should be sick."

passages.zh: 子游問孝。子曰：「今之孝者，是謂能養。
passages.en: Zi You asked what filial piety was. The Master said, "The filial piety nowadays means the support of one's parents.

passages.zh: 至於犬馬，皆能有養；
passages.en: But dogs and horses likewise are able to do something in the way of support;

passages.zh: 不敬，何以別乎？」
passages.en: without reverence, what is there to distinguish the one support given from the other?"

passages.zh: 子夏問孝。子曰：「色難。
passages.en: Zi Xia asked what filial piety was. The Master said, "The difficulty is with the countenance.

passages.zh: 有事弟子服其勞，有酒食先生饌，曾是以為孝乎？」
passages.en: If, when their elders have any troublesome affairs, the young take the toil of them, and if, when the young have wine and food, they set them before their elders, is THIS to be considered filial piety?"

passages.zh: 子曰：「吾與回言終日，不違如愚。
passages.en: The Master said, "I have talked with Hui for a whole day, and he has not made any objection to anything I said - as if he were stupid.

passages.zh: 退而省其私，亦足以發。
passages.en: He has retired, and I have examined his conduct when away from me, and found him able to illustrate my teachings.

passages.zh: 回也，不愚。」
passages.en: Hui! - He is not stupid."

passages.zh: 子曰：「視其所以，觀其所由，察其所安。
passages.en: The Master said, "See what a man does. Mark his motives. Examine in what things he rests.

passages.zh: 人焉廋哉？人焉廋哉？」
passages.en: How can a man conceal his character? How can a man conceal his character?"

passages.zh: 子曰：「溫故而知新，可以為師矣。」
passages.en: The Master said, "If a man keeps cherishing his old knowledge, so as continually to be acquiring new, he may be a teacher of others."

passages.zh: 子曰：「君子不器。」
passages.en: The Master said, "The accomplished scholar is not a utensil."

passages.zh: 子貢問君子。子曰：「先行其言，而後從之。」
passages.en: Zi Gong asked what constituted the superior man. The Master said, "He acts before he speaks, and afterwards speaks according to his actions."

passages.zh: 子曰：「君子周而不比，小人比而不周。」
passages.en: The Master said, "The superior man is catholic and not partisan. The mean man is partisan and not catholic."

passages.zh: 子曰：「學而不思則罔，思而不學則殆。」
passages.en: The Master said, "Learning without thought is labor lost; thought without learning is perilous."

passages.zh: 子曰：「攻乎異端，斯害也已！」
passages.en: The Master said, "The study of strange doctrines is injurious indeed!"

passages.zh: 子曰：「由！誨女知之乎？
passages.en: The Master said, "You, shall I teach you what knowledge is?

passages.zh: 知之為知之，不知為不知，是知也。」
passages.en: When you know a thing, to hold that you know it; and when you do not know a thing, to allow that you do not know it - this is knowledge."

passages.zh: 子張學干祿。子曰：「多聞闕疑，慎言其餘，則寡尤；
passages.en: Zi Zhang was learning with a view to official emolument. The Master said, "Hear much and put aside the points of which you stand in doubt, while you speak cautiously at the same time of the others - then you will afford few occasions for blame.

passages.zh: 多見闕殆，慎行其餘，則寡悔。
passages.en: See much and put aside the things which seem perilous, while you are cautious at the same time in carrying the others into practice - then you will have few occasions for repentance.

passages.zh: 言寡尤，行寡悔，祿在其中矣。」
passages.en: When one gives few occasions for blame in his words, and few occasions for repentance in his conduct, he is in the way to get emolument."

passages.zh: 哀公問曰：「何為則民服？」
passages.en: The Duke Ai asked, saying, "What should be done in order to secure the submission of the people?"

passages.zh: 孔子對曰：「舉直錯諸枉，則民服；舉枉錯諸直，則民不服。」
passages.en: Confucius replied, "Advance the upright and set aside the crooked, then the people will submit. Advance the crooked and set aside the upright, then the people will not submit."

passages.zh: 季康子問：「使民敬、忠以勸，如之何？」
passages.en: Ji Kang asked how to cause the people to reverence their ruler, to be faithful to him, and to go on to nerve themselves to virtue.

passages.zh: 子曰：「臨之以莊則敬，孝慈則忠，舉善而教不能，則勸。」
passages.en: The Master said, "Let him preside over them with gravity; then they will reverence him. Let him be final and kind to all; then they will be faithful to him. Let him advance the good and teach the incompetent; then they will eagerly seek to be virtuous."

passages.zh: 或謂孔子曰：「子奚不為政？」
passages.en: Some one addressed Confucius, saying, "Sir, why are you not engaged in the government?"

passages.zh: 子曰：「《書》云：『孝乎惟孝、友于兄弟，施於有政。』是亦為政，奚其為為政？」
passages.en: The Master said, "What does the Shu Jing say of filial piety? - 'You are filial, you discharge your brotherly duties. These qualities are displayed in government.' This then also constitutes the exercise of government. Why must there be THAT - making one be in the government?"

passages.zh: 子曰：「人而無信，不知其可也。
passages.en: The Master said, "I do not know how a man without truthfulness is to get on.

passages.zh: 大車無輗，小車無軏，其何以行之哉？」
passages.en: How can a large carriage be made to go without the crossbar for yoking the oxen to, or a small carriage without the arrangement for yoking the horses?"

passages.zh: 子張問：「十世可知也？」
passages.en: Zi Zhang asked whether the affairs of ten ages after could be known.

passages.zh: 子曰：「殷因於夏禮，所損益，可知也；
passages.en: Confucius said, "The Yin dynasty followed the regulations of the Xia; wherein it took from or added to them may be known.

passages.zh: 周因於殷禮，所損益，可知也；
passages.en: The Zhou dynasty has followed the regulations of Yin; wherein it took from or added to them may be known.

passages.zh: 其或繼周者，雖百世可知也。」
passages.en: Some other may follow the Zhou, but though it should be at the distance of a hundred ages, its affairs may be known."

passages.zh: 子曰：「非其鬼而祭之，諂也。
passages.en: The Master said, "For a man to sacrifice to a spirit which does not belong to him is flattery.

passages.zh: 見義不為，無勇也。」
passages.en: To see what is right and not to do it is want of courage."

passages.zh: 孔子謂季氏：「八佾舞於庭，是可忍也，孰不可忍也？」
passages.en: Confucius said of the head of the Ji family, who had eight rows of pantomimes in his area, "If he can bear to do this, what may he not bear to do?"

passages.zh: 三家者以雍徹。
passages.en: The three families used the Yong ode, while the vessels were being removed, at the conclusion of the sacrifice.

passages.zh: 子曰：「『相維辟公，天子穆穆』，奚取於三家之堂？」
passages.en: The Master said, "'Assisting are the princes; the son of heaven looks profound and grave' - what application can these words have in the hall of the three families?"

passages.zh: 子曰：「人而不仁，如禮何？
passages.en: The Master said, "If a man be without the virtues proper to humanity, what has he to do with the rites of propriety?

passages.zh: 人而不仁，如樂何？」
passages.en: If a man be without the virtues proper to humanity, what has he to do with music?"

passages.zh: 林放問禮之本。
passages.en: Lin Fang asked what was the first thing to be attended to in ceremonies.

passages.zh: 子曰：「大哉問！
passages.en: The Master said, "A great question indeed!

passages.zh: 禮，與其奢也，寧儉；
passages.en: In festive ceremonies, it is better to be sparing than extravagant.

passages.zh: 喪，與其易也，寧戚。」
passages.en: In the ceremonies of mourning, it is better that there be deep sorrow than a minute attention to observances."

passages.zh: 子曰：「夷狄之有君，不如諸夏之亡也。」
passages.en: The Master said, "The rude tribes of the east and north have their princes, and are not like the States of our great land which are without them."

passages.zh: 季氏旅於泰山。
passages.en: The chief of the Ji family was about to sacrifice to the Tai mountain.

passages.zh: 子謂冉有曰：「女弗能救與？」
passages.en: The Master said to Ran You, "Can you not save him from this?"

passages.zh: 對曰：「不能。」
passages.en: He answered, "I cannot."

passages.zh: 子曰：「嗚呼！曾謂泰山，不如林放乎？」
passages.en: Confucius said, "Alas! will you say that the Tai mountain is not so discerning as Lin Fang?"

passages.zh: 子曰：「君子無所爭，必也射乎！
passages.en: The Master said, "The student of virtue has no contentions. If it be said he cannot avoid them, shall this be in archery?

passages.zh: 揖讓而升，下而飲，其爭也君子。」
passages.en: But he bows complaisantly to his competitors; thus he ascends the hall, descends, and exacts the forfeit of drinking. In his contention, he is still the Junzi."

passages.zh: 子夏問曰：「『巧笑倩兮，美目盼兮，素以為絢兮。』何謂也？」
passages.en: Zi Xia asked, saying, "What is the meaning of the passage - 'The pretty dimples of her artful smile! The well-defined black and white of her eye! The plain ground for the colors?'"

passages.zh: 子曰：「繪事後素。」
passages.en: The Master said, "The business of laying on the colors follows (the preparation of) the plain ground."

passages.zh: 曰：「禮後乎？」
passages.en: "Ceremonies then are a subsequent thing?"

passages.zh: 子曰：「起予者商也！始可與言詩已矣。」
passages.en: The Master said, "It is Shang who can bring out my meaning. Now I can begin to talk about the odes with him."

passages.zh: 子曰：「夏禮，吾能言之，杞不足徵也；
passages.en: The Master said, "I could describe the ceremonies of the Xia dynasty, but Qi cannot sufficiently attest my words.

passages.zh: 殷禮，吾能言之，宋不足徵也。
passages.en: I could describe the ceremonies of the Yin dynasty, but Song cannot sufficiently attest my words.

passages.zh: 文獻不足故也，足則吾能徵之矣。」
passages.en: (They cannot do so) because of the insufficiency of their records and wise men. If those were sufficient, I could adduce them in support of my words."

passages.zh: 子曰：「禘自既灌而往者，吾不欲觀之矣。」
passages.en: The Master said, "At the great sacrifice, after the pouring out of the libation, I have no wish to look on."

passages.zh: 或問禘之說。
passages.en: Some one asked the meaning of the great sacrifice.

passages.zh: 子曰：「不知也。知其說者之於天下也，其如示諸斯乎！」指其掌。
passages.en: The Master said, "I do not know. He who knew its meaning would find it as easy to govern the kingdom as to look on this" - pointing to his palm.

passages.zh: 祭如在，祭神如神在。
passages.en: He sacrificed to the dead, as if they were present. He sacrificed to the spirits, as if the spirits were present.

passages.zh: 子曰：「吾不與祭，如不祭。」
passages.en: The Master said, "I consider my not being present at the sacrifice, as if I did not sacrifice."

passages.zh: 王孫賈問曰：「與其媚於奧，寧媚於竈，何謂也？」
passages.en: Wang Sun Jia asked, saying, "What is the meaning of the saying, 'It is better to pay court to the furnace than to the southwest corner?'"

passages.zh: 子曰：「不然，獲罪於天，無所禱也。」
passages.en: The Master said, "Not so. He who offends against Heaven has none to whom he can pray."

passages.zh: 子曰：「周監於二代，郁郁乎文哉！吾從周。」
passages.en: The Master said, "Zhou had the advantage of viewing the two past dynasties. How complete and elegant are its regulations! I follow Zhou."

passages.zh: 子入大廟，每事問。
passages.en: The Master, when he entered the grand temple, asked about everything.

passages.zh: 或曰：「孰謂鄹人之子知禮乎？入大廟，每事問。」
passages.en: Some one said, "Who say that the son of the man of Zou knows the rules of propriety! He has entered the grand temple and asks about everything."

passages.zh: 子聞之曰：「是禮也。」
passages.en: The Master heard the remark, and said, "This is a rule of propriety."

passages.zh: 子曰：「射不主皮，為力不同科，古之道也。」
passages.en: The Master said, "In archery it is not going through the leather which is the principal thing - because people's strength is not equal. This was the old way."

passages.zh: 子貢欲去告朔之餼羊。
passages.en: Zi Gong wished to do away with the offering of a sheep connected with the inauguration of the first day of each month.

passages.zh: 子曰：「賜也，爾愛其羊，我愛其禮。」
passages.en: The Master said, "Ci, you love the sheep; I love the ceremony."

passages.zh: 子曰：「事君盡禮，人以為諂也。」
passages.en: The Master said, "The full observance of the rules of propriety in serving one's prince is accounted by people to be flattery."

passages.zh: 定公問：「君使臣，臣事君，如之何？」
passages.en: The duke Ding asked how a prince should employ his ministers, and how ministers should serve their prince.

passages.zh: 孔子對曰：「君使臣以禮，臣事君以忠。」
passages.en: Confucius replied, "A prince should employ his minister according to according to the rules of propriety; ministers should serve their prince with faithfulness."

passages.zh: 子曰：「關雎，樂而不淫，哀而不傷。」
passages.en: The Master said, "The Guan Ju is expressive of enjoyment without being licentious, and of grief without being hurtfully excessive."

passages.zh: 哀公問社於宰我。
passages.en: The duke Ai asked Zai Wo about the altars of the spirits of the land.

passages.zh: 宰我對曰：「夏后氏以松，殷人以柏，周人以栗，曰使民戰栗。」
passages.en: Zai Wo replied, "The Xia sovereign planted the pine tree about them; the men of the Yin planted the cypress; and the men of the Zhou planted the chestnut tree, meaning thereby to cause the people to be in awe."

passages.zh: 子聞之曰：「成事不說，遂事不諫，既往不咎。」
passages.en: When the Master heard it, he said, "Things that are done, it is needless to speak about; things that have had their course, it is needless to remonstrate about; things that are past, it is needless to blame."

passages.zh: 子曰：「管仲之器小哉！」
passages.en: The Master said, "Small indeed was the capacity of Guan Zhong!"

passages.zh: 或曰：「管仲儉乎？」
passages.en: Some one said, "Was Guan Zhong parsimonious?"

passages.zh: 曰：「管氏有三歸，官事不攝，焉得儉？」
passages.en: "Guan," was the reply, "had the San Gui, and his officers performed no double duties; how can he be considered parsimonious?"

passages.zh: 「然則管仲知禮乎？」
passages.en: "Then, did Guan Zhong know the rules of propriety?"

passages.zh: 曰：「邦君樹塞門，管氏亦樹塞門；邦君為兩君之好，有反坫，管氏亦有反坫。管氏而知禮，孰不知禮？」
passages.en: The Master said, "The princes of States have a screen intercepting the view at their gates. Guan had likewise a screen at his gate. The princes of States on any friendly meeting between two of them, had a stand on which to place their inverted cups. Guan had also such a stand. If Guan knew the rules of propriety, who does not know them?"

passages.zh: 子語魯大師樂。曰：「樂其可知也：始作，翕如也；從之，純如也，皦如也，繹如也，以成。」
passages.en: The Master instructing the Grand music master of Lu said, "How to play music may be known. At the commencement of the piece, all the parts should sound together. As it proceeds, they should be in harmony while severally distinct and flowing without break, and thus on to the conclusion."

passages.zh: 儀封人請見。曰：「君子之至於斯也，吾未嘗不得見也。」
passages.en: The border warden at I requested to be introduced to the Master, saying, "When men of superior virtue have come to this, I have never been denied the privilege of seeing them."

passages.zh: 從者見之。
passages.en: The followers of the sage introduced him,

passages.zh: 出曰：「二三子，何患於喪乎？天下之無道也久矣，天將以夫子為木鐸。」
passages.en: and when he came out from the interview, he said, "My friends, why are you distressed by your master's loss of office? The kingdom has long been without the principles of truth and right; Heaven is going to use your master as a bell with its wooden tongue."

passages.zh: 子謂韶，「盡美矣，又盡善也。」
passages.en: The Master said of the Shao that it was perfectly beautiful and also perfectly good.

passages.zh: 謂武，「盡美矣，未盡善也」。
passages.en: He said of the Wu that it was perfectly beautiful but not perfectly good.

passages.zh: 子曰：「居上不寬，為禮不敬，臨喪不哀，吾何以觀之哉？」
passages.en: The Master said, "High station filled without indulgent generosity; ceremonies performed without reverence; mourning conducted without sorrow - wherewith should I contemplate such ways?"

passages.zh: 子曰：「里仁為美。
passages.en: The Master said, "It is virtuous manners which constitute the excellence of a neighborhood.

passages.zh: 擇不處仁，焉得知？」
passages.en: If a man in selecting a residence, do not fix on one where such prevail, how can he be wise?"

passages.zh: 子曰：「不仁者不可以久處約，不可以長處樂。
passages.en: The Master said, "Those who are without virtue cannot abide long either in a condition of poverty and hardship, or in a condition of enjoyment.

passages.zh: 仁者安仁，知者利仁。」
passages.en: The virtuous rest in virtue; the wise desire virtue."

passages.zh: 子曰：「唯仁者能好人，能惡人。」
passages.en: The Master said, "It is only the (truly) virtuous man, who can love, or who can hate, others."

passages.zh: 子曰：「苟志於仁矣，無惡也。」
passages.en: The Master said, "If the will be set on virtue, there will be no practice of wickedness."

passages.zh: 子曰：「富與貴是人之所欲也，不以其道得之，不處也；
passages.en: The Master said, "Riches and honors are what men desire. If it cannot be obtained in the proper way, they should not be held.

passages.zh: 貧與賤是人之所惡也，不以其道得之，不去也。
passages.en: Poverty and meanness are what men dislike. If it cannot be avoided in the proper way, they should not be avoided.

passages.zh: 君子去仁，惡乎成名？
passages.en: If a superior man abandon virtue, how can he fulfill the requirements of that name?

passages.zh: 君子無終食之間違仁，造次必於是，顛沛必於是。」
passages.en: The superior man does not, even for the space of a single meal, act contrary to virtue. In moments of haste, he cleaves to it. In seasons of danger, he cleaves to it."

passages.zh: 子曰：「我未見好仁者，惡不仁者。
passages.en: The Master said, "I have not seen a person who loved virtue, or one who hated what was not virtuous.

passages.zh: 好仁者，無以尚之；
passages.en: He who loved virtue, would esteem nothing above it.

passages.zh: 惡不仁者，其為仁矣，不使不仁者加乎其身。
passages.en: He who hated what is not virtuous, would practice virtue in such a way that he would not allow anything that is not virtuous to approach his person.

passages.zh: 有能一日用其力於仁矣乎？我未見力不足者。
passages.en: Is any one able for one day to apply his strength to virtue? I have not seen the case in which his strength would be insufficient.

passages.zh: 蓋有之矣，我未之見也。」
passages.en: Should there possibly be any such case, I have not seen it."

passages.zh: 子曰：「人之過也，各於其黨。
passages.en: The Master said, "The faults of men are characteristic of the class to which they belong.

passages.zh: 觀過，斯知仁矣。」
passages.en: By observing a man's faults, it may be known that he is virtuous."

passages.zh: 子曰：「朝聞道，夕死可矣。」
passages.en: The Master said, "If a man in the morning hear the right way, he may die in the evening without regret."

passages.zh: 子曰：「士志於道，而恥惡衣惡食者，未足與議也。」
passages.en: The Master said, "A scholar, whose mind is set on truth, and who is ashamed of bad clothes and bad food, is not fit to be discoursed with."

passages.zh: 子曰：「君子之於天下也，無適也，無莫也，義之與比。」
passages.en: The Master said, "The superior man, in the world, does not set his mind either for anything, or against anything; what is right he will follow."

passages.zh: 子曰：「君子懷德，小人懷土；
passages.en: The Master said, "The superior man thinks of virtue; the small man thinks of comfort.

passages.zh: 君子懷刑，小人懷惠。」
passages.en: The superior man thinks of the sanctions of law; the small man thinks of favors which he may receive."

passages.zh: 子曰：「放於利而行，多怨。」
passages.en: The Master said: "He who acts with a constant view to his own advantage will be much murmured against."

passages.zh: 子曰：「能以禮讓為國乎？何有？
passages.en: The Master said, "If a prince is able to govern his kingdom with the complaisance proper to the rules of propriety, what difficulty will he have?

passages.zh: 不能以禮讓為國，如禮何？」
passages.en: If he cannot govern it with that complaisance, what has he to do with the rules of propriety?"

passages.zh: 子曰：「不患無位，患所以立；
passages.en: The Master said, "A man should say, I am not concerned that I have no place, I am concerned how I may fit myself for one.

passages.zh: 不患莫己知，求為可知也。」
passages.en: I am not concerned that I am not known, I seek to be worthy to be known."

passages.zh: 子曰：「參乎！吾道一以貫之。」
passages.en: The Master said, "Shen, my doctrine is that of an all-pervading unity."

passages.zh: 曾子曰：「唯。」
passages.en: The disciple Zeng replied, "Yes."

passages.zh: 子出。門人問曰：「何謂也？」
passages.en: The Master went out, and the other disciples asked, saying, "What do his words mean?"

passages.zh: 曾子曰：「夫子之道，忠恕而已矣。」
passages.en: Zeng said, "The doctrine of our master is to be true to the principles of our nature and the benevolent exercise of them to others, this and nothing more."

passages.zh: 子曰：「君子喻於義，小人喻於利。」
passages.en: The Master said, "The mind of the superior man is conversant with righteousness; the mind of the mean man is conversant with gain."

passages.zh: 子曰：「見賢思齊焉，見不賢而內自省也。」
passages.en: The Master said, "When we see men of worth, we should think of equaling them; when we see men of a contrary character, we should turn inwards and examine ourselves."

passages.zh: 子曰：「事父母幾諫。
passages.en: The Master said, "In serving his parents, a son may remonstrate with them, but gently;

passages.zh: 見志不從，又敬不違，勞而不怨。」
passages.en: when he sees that they do not incline to follow his advice, he shows an increased degree of reverence, but does not abandon his purpose; and should they punish him, he does not allow himself to murmur."

passages.zh: 子曰：「父母在，不遠遊。
passages.en: The Master said, "While his parents are alive, the son may not go abroad to a distance.

passages.zh: 遊必有方。」
passages.en: If he does go abroad, he must have a fixed place to which he goes."

passages.zh: 子曰：「三年無改於父之道，可謂孝矣。」
passages.en: The Master said, "If the son for three years does not alter from the way of his father, he may be called filial."

passages.zh: 子曰：「父母之年，不可不知也。一則以喜，一則以懼。」
passages.en: The Master said, "The years of parents may by no means not be kept in the memory, as an occasion at once for joy and for fear."

passages.zh: 子曰：「古者言之不出，恥躬之不逮也。」
passages.en: The Master said, "The reason why the ancients did not readily give utterance to their words, was that they feared lest their actions should not come up to them."

passages.zh: 子曰：「以約失之者，鮮矣。」
passages.en: The Master said, "The cautious seldom err."

passages.zh: 子曰：「君子欲訥於言，而敏於行。」
passages.en: The Master said, "The superior man wishes to be slow in his speech and earnest in his conduct."

passages.zh: 子曰：「德不孤，必有鄰。」
passages.en: The Master said, "Virtue is not left to stand alone. He who practices it will have neighbors."

passages.zh: 子游曰：「事君數，斯辱矣，朋友數，斯疏矣。」
passages.en: Zi You said, "In serving a prince, frequent remonstrances lead to disgrace. Between friends, frequent reproofs make the friendship distant."

passages.zh: 子謂公冶長，「可妻也。雖在縲絏之中，非其罪也」。
passages.en: The Master said of Gong Ye Chang that he might be wived; although he was put in bonds, he had not been guilty of any crime.

passages.zh: 以其子妻之。
passages.en: Accordingly, he gave him his own daughter to wife.

passages.zh: 子謂南容，「邦有道，不廢；邦無道，免於刑戮。」
passages.en: The Master said of Nan Rong that if the country were well governed he would not be out of office, and if it were ill governed, he would escape punishment and disgrace.

passages.zh: 以其兄之子妻之。
passages.en: He gave him the daughter of his own elder brother to wife.

passages.zh: 子謂子賤，「君子哉若人！
passages.en: The Master said of Zi Jian, "Of superior virtue indeed is such a man!

passages.zh: 魯無君子者，斯焉取斯？」
passages.en: If there were not virtuous men in Lu, how could this man have acquired this character?"

passages.zh: 子貢問曰：「賜也何如？」
passages.en: Zi Gong asked, "What do you say of me, Ci!"

passages.zh: 子曰：「女器也。」
passages.en: The Master said, "You are a utensil."

passages.zh: 曰：「何器也？」
passages.en: "What utensil?"

passages.zh: 曰：「瑚璉也。」
passages.en: "A gemmed sacrificial utensil."

passages.zh: 或曰：「雍也，仁而不佞。」
passages.en: Some one said, "Yong is truly virtuous, but he is not ready with his tongue."

passages.zh: 子曰：「焉用佞？禦人以口給，屢憎於人。
passages.en: The Master said, "What is the good of being ready with the tongue? They who encounter men with smartness of speech for the most part procure themselves hatred.

passages.zh: 不知其仁，焉用佞？」
passages.en: I know not whether he be truly virtuous, but why should he show readiness of the tongue?"

passages.zh: 子使漆雕開仕。對曰：「吾斯之未能信。」子說。
passages.en: The Master was wishing Qi Diao Kai to enter an official employment. He replied, "I am not yet able to rest in the assurance of THIS." The Master was pleased.

passages.zh: 子曰：「道不行，乘桴浮于海。從我者其由與？」
passages.en: The Master said, "My doctrines make no way. I will get upon a raft, and float about on the sea. He that will accompany me will be You, I dare to say."

passages.zh: 子路聞之喜。
passages.en: Zi Lu hearing this was glad,

passages.zh: 子曰：「由也好勇過我，無所取材。」
passages.en: upon which the Master said, "You is fonder of daring than I am. He does not exercise his judgment upon matters."

passages.zh: 孟武伯問：「子路仁乎？」
passages.en: Meng Wu asked about Zi Lu, whether he was perfectly virtuous.

passages.zh: 子曰：「不知也。」
passages.en: The Master said, "I do not know."

passages.zh: 又問。子曰：「由也，千乘之國，可使治其賦也，不知其仁也。」
passages.en: He asked again, when the Master replied, "You, in a kingdom of a thousand chariots, might be employed to manage the military levies, but I do not know whether he be perfectly virtuous."

passages.zh: 「求也何如？」子曰：「求也，千室之邑，百乘之家，可使為之宰也，不知其仁也。」
passages.en: "And what do you say of Qiu?" The Master replied, "Qiu, in a city of a thousand families, or a clan of a hundred chariots, might be employed as governor, but I do not know whether he is perfectly virtuous."

passages.zh: 「赤也何如？」子曰：「赤也，束帶立於朝，可使與賓客言也，不知其仁也。」
passages.en: "What do you say of Chi?" The Master replied, "Chi, with his sash girt and standing in a court, might be employed to converse with the visitors and guests, but I do not know whether he is perfectly virtuous."

passages.zh: 子謂子貢曰：「女與回也孰愈？」
passages.en: The Master said to Zi Gong, "Which do you consider superior, yourself or Hui?"

passages.zh: 對曰：「賜也何敢望回。回也聞一以知十，賜也聞一以知二。」
passages.en: Zi Gong replied, "How dare I compare myself with Hui? Hui hears one point and knows all about a subject; I hear one point, and know a second."

passages.zh: 子曰：「弗如也！吾與女弗如也。」
passages.en: The Master said, "You are not equal to him. I grant you, you are not equal to him."

passages.zh: 宰予晝寢。
passages.en: Zai Yu being asleep during the daytime,

passages.zh: 子曰：「朽木不可雕也，糞土之牆不可杇也，於予與何誅。」
passages.en: the Master said, "Rotten wood cannot be carved; a wall of dirty earth will not receive the trowel. This Yu! - what is the use of my reproving him?"

passages.zh: 子曰：「始吾於人也，聽其言而信其行；今吾於人也，聽其言而觀其行。於予與改是。」
passages.en: The Master said, "At first, my way with men was to hear their words, and give them credit for their conduct. Now my way is to hear their words, and look at their conduct. It is from Yu that I have learned to make this change."

passages.zh: 子曰：「吾未見剛者。」
passages.en: The Master said, "I have not seen a firm and unbending man."

passages.zh: 或對曰：「申棖。」
passages.en: Some one replied, "There is Shen Cheng."

passages.zh: 子曰：「棖也慾，焉得剛？」
passages.en: "Cheng," said the Master, "is under the influence of his passions; how can he be pronounced firm and unbending?"

passages.zh: 子貢曰：「我不欲人之加諸我也，吾亦欲無加諸人。」
passages.en: Zi Gong said, "What I do not wish men to do to me, I also wish not to do to men."

passages.zh: 子曰：「賜也，非爾所及也。」
passages.en: The Master said, "Ci, you have not attained to that."

passages.zh: 子貢曰：「夫子之文章，可得而聞也；
passages.en: Zi Gong said, "The Master's personal displays of his principles and ordinary descriptions of them may be heard.

passages.zh: 夫子之言性與天道，不可得而聞也。」
passages.en: His discourses about man's nature, and the way of Heaven, cannot be heard."

passages.zh: 子路有聞，未之能行，唯恐有聞。
passages.en: When Zi Lu heard anything, if he had not yet succeeded in carrying it into practice, he was only afraid lest he should hear something else.

passages.zh: 子貢問曰：「孔文子何以謂之文也？」
passages.en: Zi Gong asked, saying, "On what ground did Kong Wen get that title of Wen?"

passages.zh: 子曰：「敏而好學，不恥下問，是以謂之文也。」
passages.en: The Master said, "He was of an active nature and yet fond of learning, and he was not ashamed to ask and learn of his inferiors! On these grounds he has been styled Wen."

passages.zh: 子謂子產，「有君子之道四焉：其行己也恭，其事上也敬，其養民也惠，其使民也義。」
passages.en: The Master said of Zi Chan that he had four of the characteristics of a superior man - in his conduct of himself, he was humble; in serving his superior, he was respectful; in nourishing the people, he was kind; in ordering the people, he was just.

passages.zh: 子曰：「晏平仲善與人交，久而敬之。」
passages.en: The Master said, "Yan Ping knew well how to maintain friendly intercourse. The acquaintance might be long, but he showed the same respect as at first."

passages.zh: 子曰：「臧文仲居蔡，山節藻梲，何如其知也？」
passages.en: The Master said, "Zang Wen kept a large tortoise in a house, on the capitals of the pillars of which he had hills made, and with representations of duckweed on the small pillars above the beams supporting the rafters. Of what sort was his wisdom?"

passages.zh: 子張問曰：「令尹子文三仕為令尹，無喜色；三已之，無慍色。舊令尹之政，必以告新令尹。何如？」
passages.en: Zi Zhang asked, saying, "The minister Zi Wen thrice took office, and manifested no joy in his countenance. Thrice he retired from office, and manifested no displeasure. He made it a point to inform the new minister of the way in which he had conducted the government - what do you say of him?"

passages.zh: 子曰：「忠矣。」
passages.en: The Master replied. "He was loyal."

passages.zh: 曰：「仁矣乎？」
passages.en: "Was he perfectly virtuous?"

passages.zh: 曰：「未知，焉得仁？」
passages.en: "I do not know. How can he be pronounced perfectly virtuous?"

passages.zh: 「崔子弒齊君，陳文子有馬十乘，棄而違之。至於他邦，則曰：『猶吾大夫崔子也。』違之。之一邦，則又曰：『猶吾大夫崔子也。』違之。何如？」
passages.en: Zi Zhang proceeded, "When the officer Cui killed the prince of Qi, Chen Wen, though he was the owner of forty horses, abandoned them and left the country. Coming to another state, he said, 'They are here like our great officer, Cui,' and left it. He came to a second state, and again said 'They are here like our great officer, Cui,' and left it also - what do you say of him?"

passages.zh: 子曰：「清矣。」
passages.en: The Master replied, "He was pure."

passages.zh: 曰：「仁矣乎？」
passages.en: "Was he perfectly virtuous?"

passages.zh: 曰：「未知。焉得仁？」
passages.en: "I do not know. How can he be pronounced perfectly virtuous?"

passages.zh: 季文子三思而後行。
passages.en: Ji Wen thought thrice, and then acted.

passages.zh: 子聞之，曰：「再，斯可矣。」
passages.en: When the Master was informed of it, he said, "Twice may do."

passages.zh: 子曰：「甯武子邦有道則知，邦無道則愚。
passages.en: The Master said, "When good order prevailed in his country, Ning Wu acted the part of a wise man. When his country was in disorder, he acted the part of a stupid man.

passages.zh: 其知可及也，其愚不可及也。」
passages.en: Others may equal his wisdom, but they cannot equal his stupidity."

passages.zh: 子在陳曰：「歸與！歸與！吾黨之小子狂簡，斐然成章，不知所以裁之。」
passages.en: When the Master was in Chen, he said, "Let me return! Let me return! The little children of my school are ambitious and too hasty. They are accomplished and complete so far, but they do not know how to restrict and shape themselves."

passages.zh: 子曰：「伯夷、叔齊不念舊惡，怨是用希。」
passages.en: The Master said, "Bo Yi and Shu Qi did not keep the former wickednesses of men in mind, and hence the resentments directed towards them were few."

passages.zh: 子曰：「孰謂微生高直？或乞醯焉，乞諸其鄰而與之。」
passages.en: The Master said, "Who says of Wei Sheng Gao that he is upright? One begged some vinegar of him, and he begged it of a neighbor and gave it to the man."

passages.zh: 子曰：「巧言、令色、足恭，左丘明恥之，丘亦恥之。
passages.en: The Master said, "Fine words, an insinuating appearance, and excessive respect - Zuo Qiu Ming was ashamed of them. I also am ashamed of them.

passages.zh: 匿怨而友其人，左丘明恥之，丘亦恥之。」
passages.en: To conceal resentment against a person, and appear friendly with him - Zuo Qiu Ming was ashamed of such conduct. I also am ashamed of it."

passages.zh: 顏淵、季路侍。子曰：「盍各言爾志？」
passages.en: Yan Yuan and Ji Lu being by his side, the Master said to them, "Come, let each of you tell his wishes."

passages.zh: 子路曰：「願車馬、衣輕裘，與朋友共。敝之而無憾。」
passages.en: Zi Lu said, "I should like, having chariots and horses, and light fur clothes, to share them with my friends, and though they should spoil them, I would not be displeased."

passages.zh: 顏淵曰：「願無伐善，無施勞。」
passages.en: Yan Yuan said, "I should like not to boast of my excellence, nor to make a display of my meritorious deeds."

passages.zh: 子路曰：「願聞子之志。」
passages.en: Zi Lu then said, "I should like, sir, to hear your wishes."

passages.zh: 子曰：「老者安之，朋友信之，少者懷之。」
passages.en: The Master said, "They are, in regard to the aged, to give them rest; in regard to friends, to show them sincerity; in regard to the young, to treat them tenderly."

passages.zh: 子曰：「已矣乎！吾未見能見其過而內自訟者也。」
passages.en: The Master said, "It is all over. I have not yet seen one who could perceive his faults, and inwardly accuse himself."

passages.zh: 子曰：「十室之邑，必有忠信如丘者焉，不如丘之好學也。」
passages.en: The Master said, "In a hamlet of ten families, there may be found one honorable and sincere as I am, but not so fond of learning."

passages.zh: 子曰：「雍也可使南面。」
passages.en: The Master said, "There is Yong - he might occupy the place of a prince."

passages.zh: 仲弓問子桑伯子，子曰：「可也簡。」
passages.en: Zhong Gong asked about Zi Sang Bo Zi. The Master said, "He may pass. He does not mind small matters."

passages.zh: 仲弓曰：「居敬而行簡，以臨其民，不亦可乎？
passages.en: Zhong Gong said, "If a man cherish in himself a reverential feeling of the necessity of attention to business, though he may be easy in small matters in his government of the people, that may be allowed.

passages.zh: 居簡而行簡，無乃大簡乎？」
passages.en: But if he cherish in himself that easy feeling, and also carry it out in his practice, is not such an easy mode of procedure excessive?"

passages.zh: 子曰：「雍之言然。」
passages.en: The Master said, "Yong's words are right."

passages.zh: 哀公問：「弟子孰為好學？」
passages.en: The Duke Ai asked which of the disciples loved to learn.

passages.zh: 孔子對曰：「有顏回者好學，不遷怒，不貳過。
passages.en: Confucius replied to him, "There was Yan Hui; HE loved to learn. He did not transfer his anger; he did not repeat a fault.

passages.zh: 不幸短命死矣！
passages.en: Unfortunately, his appointed time was short and he died;

passages.zh: 今也則亡，未聞好學者也。」
passages.en: and now there is not such another. I have not yet heard of any one who loves to learn as he did."

passages.zh: 子華使於齊，冉子為其母請粟。
passages.en: Zi Hua being employed on a mission to Qi, the disciple Ran requested grain for his mother.

passages.zh: 子曰：「與之釜。」
passages.en: The Master said, "Give her a fu."

passages.zh: 請益。曰：「與之庾。」
passages.en: Ran requested more. "Give her an yu," said the Master.

passages.zh: 冉子與之粟五秉。
passages.en: Ran gave her five bing.

passages.zh: 子曰：「赤之適齊也，乘肥馬，衣輕裘。吾聞之也，君子周急不繼富。」
passages.en: The Master said, "When Chi was proceeding to Qi, he had fat horses to his carriage, and wore light furs. I have heard that a superior man helps the distressed, but does not add to the wealth of the rich."

passages.zh: 原思為之宰，與之粟九百，辭。
passages.en: Yuan Si being made governor of his town by the Master, he gave him nine hundred measures of grain, but Si declined them.

passages.zh: 子曰：「毋！以與爾鄰里鄉黨乎！」
passages.en: The Master said, "Do not decline them. May you not give them away in the neighborhoods, hamlets, towns, and villages?"

passages.zh: 子謂仲弓曰：「犂牛之子騂且角，雖欲勿用，山川其舍諸？」
passages.en: The Master, speaking of Zhong Gong, said, "If the calf of a brindled cow be red and horned, although men may not wish to use it, would the spirits of the mountains and rivers put it aside?"

passages.zh: 子曰：「回也，其心三月不違仁，其餘則日月至焉而已矣。」
passages.en: The Master said, "Such was Hui that for three months there would be nothing in his mind contrary to perfect virtue. The others may attain to this on some days or in some months, but nothing more."

passages.zh: 季康子問：「仲由可使從政也與？」
passages.en: Ji Kang asked about Zhong You, whether he was fit to be employed as an officer of government.

passages.zh: 子曰：「由也果，於從政乎何有？」
passages.en: The Master said, "You is a man of decision; what difficulty would he find in being an officer of government?"

passages.zh: 曰：「賜也，可使從政也與？」曰：「賜也達，於從政乎何有？」
passages.en: Kang asked, "Is Ci fit to be employed as an officer of government?" and was answered, "Ci is a man of intelligence; what difficulty would he find in being an officer of government?"

passages.zh: 曰：「求也，可使從政也與？」曰：「求也藝，於從政乎何有？」
passages.en: Asked, "Is Qui fit to be employed as an officer of government?" the master replied, "Qiu is a man of various ability; what difficulty would he find in being an officer of government?"

passages.zh: 季氏使閔子騫為費宰。
passages.en: The chief of the Ji family sent to ask Min Zi Qian to be governor of Fei.

passages.zh: 閔子騫曰：「善為我辭焉。如有復我者，則吾必在汶上矣。」
passages.en: Min Zi Qian said, "Decline the offer for me politely. If any one come again to me with a second invitation, I shall be obliged to go and live on the banks of the Wen."

passages.zh: 伯牛有疾，子問之，自牖執其手，曰：「亡之，命矣夫！
passages.en: Bo Niu being ill, the Master went to ask for him. He took hold of his hand through the window, and said, "It is killing him. It is the appointment of Heaven, alas!

passages.zh: 斯人也而有斯疾也！斯人也而有斯疾也！」
passages.en: That such a man should have such a sickness! That such a man should have such a sickness!"

passages.zh: 子曰：「賢哉回也！一簞食，一瓢飲，在陋巷。
passages.en: The Master said, "Admirable indeed was the virtue of Hui! With a single bamboo dish of rice, a single gourd dish of drink, and living in his mean narrow lane,

passages.zh: 人不堪其憂，回也不改其樂。
passages.en: while others could not have endured the distress, he did not allow his joy to be affected by it.

passages.zh: 賢哉回也！」
passages.en: Admirable indeed was the virtue of Hui!"

passages.zh: 冉求曰：「非不說子之道，力不足也。」
passages.en: Ran Qiu said, "It is not that I do not delight in your doctrines, but my strength is insufficient."

passages.zh: 子曰：「力不足者，中道而廢。今女畫。」
passages.en: The Master said, "Those whose strength is insufficient give over in the middle of the way but now you limit yourself."

passages.zh: 子謂子夏曰：「女為君子儒，無為小人儒。」
passages.en: The Master said to Zi Xia, "Do you be a scholar after the style of the superior man, and not after that of the mean man."

passages.zh: 子游為武城宰。子曰：「女得人焉爾乎？」
passages.en: Zi You being governor of Wu Cheng, the Master said to him, "Have you got good men there?"

passages.zh: 曰：「有澹臺滅明者，行不由徑。非公事，未嘗至於偃之室也。」
passages.en: He answered, "There is Dan Tai Mie Ming, who never in walking takes a short cut, and excepting on public business never comes to my office."

passages.zh: 子曰：「孟之反不伐，奔而殿。
passages.en: The Master said, "Meng Zhi Fan does not boast of his merit. Being in the rear on an occasion of flight,

passages.zh: 將入門，策其馬，曰：『非敢後也，馬不進也。』」
passages.en: when they were about to enter the gate, he whipped up his horse, saying, 'It is not that I dare to be last. My horse would not advance.'"

passages.zh: 子曰：「不有祝鮀之佞而有宋朝之美，難乎免於今之世矣！」
passages.en: The Master said, "Without the specious speech of the litanist Tuo and the beauty of the prince Zhao of Song, it is difficult to escape in the present age."

passages.zh: 子曰：「誰能出不由戶？何莫由斯道也？」
passages.en: The Master said, "Who can go out but by the door? How is it that men will not walk according to these ways?"

passages.zh: 子曰：「質勝文則野，文勝質則史。
passages.en: The Master said, "Where the solid qualities are in excess of accomplishments, we have rusticity; where the accomplishments are in excess of the solid qualities, we have the manners of a clerk.

passages.zh: 文質彬彬，然後君子。」
passages.en: When the accomplishments and solid qualities are equally blended, we then have the man of virtue."

passages.zh: 子曰：「人之生也直，罔之生也幸而免。」
passages.en: The Master said, "Man is born for uprightness. If a man lose his uprightness, and yet live, his escape from death is the effect of mere good fortune."

passages.zh: 子曰：「知之者不如好之者，好之者不如樂之者。」
passages.en: The Master said, "They who know the truth are not equal to those who love it, and they who love it are not equal to those who delight in it."

passages.zh: 子曰：「中人以上，可以語上也；
passages.en: The Master said, "To those whose talents are above mediocrity, the highest subjects may be announced.

passages.zh: 中人以下，不可以語上也。」
passages.en: To those who are below mediocrity, the highest subjects may not be announced."

passages.zh: 樊遲問知。子曰：「務民之義，敬鬼神而遠之，可謂知矣。」
passages.en: Fan Chi asked what constituted wisdom. The Master said, "To give one's self earnestly to the duties due to men, and, while respecting spiritual beings, to keep aloof from them, may be called wisdom."

passages.zh: 問仁。曰：「仁者先難而後獲，可謂仁矣。」
passages.en: He asked about perfect virtue. The Master said, "The man of virtue makes the difficulty to be overcome his first business, and success only a subsequent consideration - this may be called perfect virtue."

passages.zh: 子曰：「知者樂水，仁者樂山；
passages.en: The Master said, "The wise find pleasure in water; the virtuous find pleasure in hills.

passages.zh: 知者動，仁者靜；
passages.en: The wise are active; the virtuous are tranquil.

passages.zh: 知者樂，仁者壽。」
passages.en: The wise are joyful; the virtuous are long-lived."

passages.zh: 子曰：「齊一變，至於魯；魯一變，至於道。」
passages.en: The Master said, "Qi, by one change, would come to the State of Lu. Lu, by one change, would come to a State where true principles predominated."

passages.zh: 子曰：「觚不觚，觚哉！觚哉！」
passages.en: The Master said, "A cornered vessel without corners - a strange cornered vessel! A strange cornered vessel!"

passages.zh: 宰我問曰：「仁者，雖告之曰：『井有仁焉。』其從之也？」
passages.en: Zai Wo asked, saying, "A benevolent man, though it be told him, 'There is a man in the well' will go in after him, I suppose."

passages.zh: 子曰：「何為其然也？君子可逝也，不可陷也；可欺也，不可罔也。」
passages.en: Confucius said, "Why should he do so? A superior man may be made to go to the well, but he cannot be made to go down into it. He may be imposed upon, but he cannot be fooled."

passages.zh: 子曰：「君子博學於文，約之以禮，亦可以弗畔矣夫！」
passages.en: The Master said, "The superior man, extensively studying all learning, and keeping himself under the restraint of the rules of propriety, may thus likewise not overstep what is right."

passages.zh: 子見南子，子路不說。
passages.en: The Master having visited Nan Zi, Zi Lu was displeased,

passages.zh: 夫子矢之曰：「予所否者，天厭之！天厭之！」
passages.en: on which the Master swore, saying, "Wherein I have done improperly, may Heaven reject me! may Heaven reject me!"

passages.zh: 子曰：「中庸之為德也，其至矣乎！民鮮久矣。」
passages.en: The Master said, "Perfect is the virtue which is according to the Constant Mean! Rare for a long time has been its practice among the people."

passages.zh: 子貢曰：「如有博施於民而能濟眾，何如？可謂仁乎？」
passages.en: Zi Gong said, "Suppose the case of a man extensively conferring benefits on the people, and able to assist all, what would you say of him? Might he be called perfectly virtuous?"

passages.zh: 子曰：「何事於仁，必也聖乎！堯舜其猶病諸！
passages.en: The Master said, "Why speak only of virtue in connection with him? Must he not have the qualities of a sage? Even Yao and Shun were still solicitous about this.

passages.zh: 夫仁者，己欲立而立人，己欲達而達人。
passages.en: Now the man of perfect virtue, wishing to be established himself, seeks also to establish others; wishing to be enlarged himself, he seeks also to enlarge others.

passages.zh: 能近取譬，可謂仁之方也已。」
passages.en: To be able to judge of others by what is nigh in ourselves - this may be called the art of virtue."

passages.zh: 子曰：「述而不作，信而好古，竊比於我老彭。」
passages.en: The Master said, "A transmitter and not a maker, believing in and loving the ancients, I venture to compare myself with our old Peng."

passages.zh: 子曰：「默而識之，學而不厭，誨人不倦，何有於我哉？」
passages.en: The Master said, "The silent treasuring up of knowledge; learning without satiety; and instructing others without being wearied - which one of these things belongs to me?"

passages.zh: 子曰：「德之不脩，學之不講，聞義不能徙，不善不能改，是吾憂也。」
passages.en: The Master said, "The learning virtue without proper cultivation; the not thoroughly discussing what is learned; not being able to move towards righteousness of which a knowledge is gained; and not being able to change what is not good - these are the things which occasion me solicitude."

passages.zh: 子之燕居，申申如也，夭夭如也。
passages.en: When the Master was unoccupied with business, his manner was easy, and he looked pleased.

passages.zh: 子曰：「甚矣吾衰也！
passages.en: The Master said, "Extreme is my decay.

passages.zh: 久矣吾不復夢見周公。」
passages.en: For a long time, I have not dreamed, as I was wont to do, that I saw the duke of Zhou."

passages.zh: 子曰：「志於道，據於德，依於仁，游於藝。」
passages.en: The Master said, "Let the will be set on the path of duty. Let every attainment in what is good be firmly grasped. Let perfect virtue be accorded with. Let relaxation and enjoyment be found in the polite arts."

passages.zh: 子曰：「自行束脩以上，吾未嘗無誨焉。」
passages.en: The Master said, "From the man bringing his bundle of dried flesh for my teaching upwards, I have never refused instruction to any one."

passages.zh: 子曰：「不憤不啟，不悱不發，舉一隅不以三隅反，則不復也。」
passages.en: The Master said, "I do not open up the truth to one who is not eager to get knowledge, nor help out any one who is not anxious to explain himself. When I have presented one corner of a subject to any one, and he cannot from it learn the other three, I do not repeat my lesson."

passages.zh: 子食於有喪者之側，未嘗飽也。
passages.en: When the Master was eating by the side of a mourner, he never ate to the full.

passages.zh: 子於是日哭，則不歌。
passages.en: On a day when the master had wept, he did not sing.

passages.zh: 子謂顏淵曰：「用之則行，舍之則藏，唯我與爾有是夫！」
passages.en: The Master said to Yan Yuan, "When called to office, to undertake its duties; when not so called, to lie retired - it is only I and you who have attained to this."

passages.zh: 子路曰：「子行三軍，則誰與？」
passages.en: Zi Lu said, "If you had the conduct of the armies of a great state, whom would you have to act with you?"

passages.zh: 子曰：「暴虎馮河，死而無悔者，吾不與也。必也臨事而懼，好謀而成者也。」
passages.en: The Master said, "He who will unarmed attack a tiger, or cross a river without a boat, dying without any regret, I would not have act with me. My associate must be the man who proceeds to action full of solicitude, who is fond of adjusting his plans, and then carries them into execution."

passages.zh: 子曰：「富而可求也，雖執鞭之士，吾亦為之。
passages.en: The Master said, "If the search for riches is sure to be successful, though I should become a groom with whip in hand to get them, I will do so.

passages.zh: 如不可求，從吾所好。」
passages.en: As the search may not be successful, I will follow after that which I love."

passages.zh: 子之所慎：齊，戰，疾。
passages.en: The things in reference to which the Master exercised the greatest caution were - fasting, war, and sickness.

passages.zh: 子在齊聞韶，三月不知肉味。
passages.en: When the Master was in Qi, he heard the Shao, and for three months did not know the taste of flesh.

passages.zh: 曰：「不圖為樂之至於斯也！」
passages.en: He said, "I did not think that music could have been made so excellent as this."

passages.zh: 冉有曰：「夫子為衛君乎？」
passages.en: Ran You said, "Is our Master for the ruler of Wei?"

passages.zh: 子貢曰：「諾。吾將問之。」
passages.en: Zi Gong said, "Oh! I will ask him."

passages.zh: 入，曰：「伯夷、叔齊何人也？」
passages.en: He went in accordingly, and said, "What sort of men were Bo Yi and Shu Qi?"

passages.zh: 曰：「古之賢人也。」
passages.en: "They were ancient worthies," said the Master.

passages.zh: 曰：「怨乎？」
passages.en: "Did they have any repinings because of their course?"

passages.zh: 曰：「求仁而得仁，又何怨。」
passages.en: The Master again replied, "They sought to act virtuously, and they did so; what was there for them to repine about?"

passages.zh: 出，曰：「夫子不為也。」
passages.en: On this, Zi Gong went out and said, "Our Master is not for him."

passages.zh: 子曰：「飯疏食飲水，曲肱而枕之，樂亦在其中矣。
passages.en: The Master said, "With coarse rice to eat, with water to drink, and my bended arm for a pillow; I have still joy in the midst of these things.

passages.zh: 不義而富且貴，於我如浮雲。」
passages.en: Riches and honors acquired by unrighteousness, are to me as a floating cloud."

passages.zh: 子曰：「加我數年，五十以學易，可以無大過矣。」
passages.en: The Master said, "If some years were added to my life, I would give fifty to the study of the Yi, and then I might come to be without great faults."

passages.zh: 子所雅言，詩、書、執禮，皆雅言也。
passages.en: The Master's frequent themes of discourse were: the Odes, the History, and the maintenance of the Rules of Propriety. On all these he frequently discoursed.

passages.zh: 葉公問孔子於子路，子路不對。
passages.en: The Duke of She asked Zi Lu about Confucius, and Zi Lu did not answer him.

passages.zh: 子曰：「女奚不曰，其為人也，發憤忘食，樂以忘憂，不知老之將至云爾。」
passages.en: The Master said, "Why did you not say to him, 'He is simply a man, who in his eager pursuit of knowledge forgets his food, who in the joy of its attainment forgets his sorrows, and who does not perceive that old age is coming on?'"

passages.zh: 子曰：「我非生而知之者，好古，敏以求之者也。」
passages.en: The Master said, "I am not one who was born in the possession of knowledge; I am one who is fond of antiquity, and earnest in seeking it there."

passages.zh: 子不語怪，力，亂，神。
passages.en: The subjects on which the Master did not talk, were: extraordinary things, feats of strength, disorder, and spiritual beings.

passages.zh: 子曰：「三人行，必有我師焉。
passages.en: The Master said, "When I walk along with two others, they may serve me as my teachers.

passages.zh: 擇其善者而從之，其不善者而改之。」
passages.en: I will select their good qualities and follow them, their bad qualities and avoid them."

passages.zh: 子曰：「天生德於予，桓魋其如予何？」
passages.en: The Master said, "Heaven produced the virtue that is in me. Huan Tui - what can he do to me?"

passages.zh: 子曰：「二三子以我為隱乎？吾無隱乎爾。
passages.en: The Master said, "Do you think, my disciples, that I have any concealments? I conceal nothing from you.

passages.zh: 吾無行而不與二三子者，是丘也。」
passages.en: There is nothing which I do that is not shown to you, my disciples; that is my way."

passages.zh: 子以四教：文，行，忠，信。
passages.en: There were four things which the Master taught: letters, ethics, devotion of soul, and truthfulness.

passages.zh: 子曰：「聖人，吾不得而見之矣；得見君子者，斯可矣。」
passages.en: The Master said, "A sage it is not mine to see; could I see a man of real talent and virtue, that would satisfy me."

passages.zh: 子曰：「善人，吾不得而見之矣；得見有恆者，斯可矣。
passages.en: The Master said, "A good man it is not mine to see; could I see a man possessed of constancy, that would satisfy me.

passages.zh: 亡而為有，虛而為盈，約而為泰，難乎有恆矣。」
passages.en: Having not and yet affecting to have, empty and yet affecting to be full, straitened and yet affecting to be at ease - it is difficult with such characteristics to have constancy."

passages.zh: 子釣而不綱，弋不射宿。
passages.en: The Master angled, but did not use a net. He shot, but not at birds perching.

passages.zh: 子曰：「蓋有不知而作之者，我無是也。
passages.en: The Master said, "There may be those who act without knowing why. I do not do so.

passages.zh: 多聞擇其善者而從之，多見而識之，知之次也。」
passages.en: Hearing much and selecting what is good and following it; seeing much and keeping it in memory - this is the second style of knowledge."

passages.zh: 互鄉難與言，童子見，門人惑。
passages.en: It was difficult to talk (profitably and reputably) with the people of Hu Xiang, and a lad of that place having had an interview with the Master, the disciples doubted.

passages.zh: 子曰：「與其進也，不與其退也，唯何甚！
passages.en: The Master said, "I admit people's approach to me without committing myself as to what they may do when they have retired. Why must one be so severe?

passages.zh: 人潔己以進，與其潔也，不保其往也。」
passages.en: If a man purify himself to wait upon me, I receive him so purified, without guaranteeing his past conduct."

passages.zh: 子曰：「仁遠乎哉？我欲仁，斯仁至矣。」
passages.en: The Master said, "Is virtue a thing remote? I wish to be virtuous, and lo! virtue is at hand."

passages.zh: 陳司敗問昭公知禮乎？
passages.en: The minister of crime of Chen asked whether the duke Zhao knew propriety,

passages.zh: 孔子曰：「知禮。」
passages.en: and Confucius said, "He knew propriety."

passages.zh: 孔子退，揖巫馬期而進之，曰：「吾聞君子不黨，君子亦黨乎？
passages.en: Confucius having retired, the minister bowed to Wu Ma Qi to come forward, and said, "I have heard that the superior man is not a partisan. May the superior man be a partisan also?

passages.zh: 君取於吳為同姓，謂之吳孟子。君而知禮，孰不知禮？」
passages.en: The prince married a daughter of the house of Wu, of the same surname with himself, and called her, 'The elder Zi of Wu.' If the prince knew propriety, who does not know it?"

passages.zh: 巫馬期以告。子曰：「丘也幸，苟有過，人必知之。」
passages.en: Wu Ma Qi reported these remarks, and the Master said, "I am fortunate! If I have any errors, people are sure to know them."

passages.zh: 子與人歌而善，必使反之，而後和之。
passages.en: When the Master was in company with a person who was singing, if he sang well, he would make him repeat the song, while he accompanied it with his own voice.

passages.zh: 子曰：「文，莫吾猶人也。躬行君子，則吾未之有得。」
passages.en: The Master said, "In letters I am perhaps equal to other men, but the character of the superior man, carrying out in his conduct what he professes, is what I have not yet attained to."

passages.zh: 子曰：「若聖與仁，則吾豈敢？抑為之不厭，誨人不倦，則可謂云爾已矣。」
passages.en: The Master said, "The sage and the man of perfect virtue - how dare I rank myself with them? That I strive to become such without satiety, and teach others without weariness - this much can be said of me."

passages.zh: 公西華曰：「正唯弟子不能學也。」
passages.en: Gong Xi Hua said, "This is just what we, the disciples, cannot imitate you in."

passages.zh: 子疾病，子路請禱。
passages.en: The Master being very sick, Zi Lu asked leave to pray for him.

passages.zh: 子曰：「有諸？」
passages.en: He said, "May such a thing be done?"

passages.zh: 子路對曰：「有之。誄曰：『禱爾于上下神祇。』」
passages.en: Zi Lu replied, "It may. In the Eulogies it is said, 'Prayer has been made for thee to the spirits of the upper and lower worlds.'"

passages.zh: 子曰：「丘之禱久矣。」
passages.en: The Master said, "My praying has been for a long time."

passages.zh: 子曰：「奢則不孫，儉則固。與其不孫也，寧固。」
passages.en: The Master said, "Extravagance leads to insubordination, and parsimony to meanness. It is better to be mean than to be insubordinate."

passages.zh: 子曰：「君子坦蕩蕩，小人長戚戚。」
passages.en: The Master said, "The superior man is satisfied and composed; the mean man is always full of distress."

passages.zh: 子溫而厲，威而不猛，恭而安。
passages.en: The Master was mild, and yet dignified; majestic, and yet not fierce; respectful, and yet easy.

passages.zh: 子曰：「泰伯，其可謂至德也已矣！
passages.en: The Master said, "Tai Bo may be said to have reached the highest point of virtuous action.

passages.zh: 三以天下讓，民無得而稱焉。」
passages.en: Thrice he declined the kingdom, and the people in ignorance of his motives could not express their approbation of his conduct."

passages.zh: 子曰：「恭而無禮則勞，慎而無禮則葸，勇而無禮則亂，直而無禮則絞。
passages.en: The Master said, "Respectfulness, without the rules of propriety, becomes laborious bustle; carefulness, without the rules of propriety, becomes timidity; boldness, without the rules of propriety, becomes insubordination; straightforwardness, without the rules of propriety, becomes rudeness.

passages.zh: 君子篤於親，則民興於仁；
passages.en: When those who are in high stations perform well all their duties to their relations, the people are aroused to virtue.

passages.zh: 故舊不遺，則民不偷。」
passages.en: When old friends are not neglected by them, the people are preserved from meanness."

passages.zh: 曾子有疾，召門弟子曰：「啟予足！啟予手！
passages.en: The philosopher Zeng being ill, he called to him the disciples of his school, and said, "Uncover my feet, uncover my hands.

passages.zh: 《詩》云『戰戰兢兢，如臨深淵，如履薄冰。』
passages.en: It is said in the Book of Poetry, 'We should be apprehensive and cautious, as if on the brink of a deep gulf, as if treading on thin ice.'

passages.zh: 而今而後，吾知免夫！小子！」
passages.en: Now and hereafter, I know my escape from all injury to my person. O ye, my little children."

passages.zh: 曾子有疾，孟敬子問之。
passages.en: The philosopher Zeng being ill, Meng Jing went to ask how he was.

passages.zh: 曾子言曰：「鳥之將死，其鳴也哀；
passages.en: Zeng said to him, "When a bird is about to die, its notes are mournful;

passages.zh: 人之將死，其言也善。
passages.en: when a man is about to die, his words are good.

passages.zh: 君子所貴乎道者三：動容貌，斯遠暴慢矣；
passages.en: There are three principles of conduct which the man of high rank should consider specially important: that in his deportment and manner he keep from violence and heedlessness;

passages.zh: 正顏色，斯近信矣；
passages.en: that in regulating his countenance he keep near to sincerity;

passages.zh: 出辭氣，斯遠鄙倍矣。
passages.en: and that in his words and tones he keep far from lowness and impropriety.

passages.zh: 籩豆之事，則有司存。」
passages.en: As to such matters as attending to the sacrificial vessels, there are the proper officers for them."

passages.zh: 曾子曰：「以能問於不能，以多問於寡；
passages.en: The philosopher Zeng said, "Gifted with ability, and yet putting questions to those who were not so; possessed of much, and yet putting questions to those possessed of little;

passages.zh: 有若無，實若虛，犯而不校，昔者吾友嘗從事於斯矣。」
passages.en: having, as though he had not; full, and yet counting himself as empty; offended against, and yet entering into no altercation; formerly I had a friend who pursued this style of conduct."

passages.zh: 曾子曰：「可以託六尺之孤，可以寄百里之命，臨大節而不可奪也。
passages.en: The philosopher Zeng said, "Suppose that there is an individual who can be entrusted with the charge of a young orphan prince, and can be commissioned with authority over a state of a hundred li, and whom no emergency however great can drive from his principles -

passages.zh: 君子人與？君子人也。」
passages.en: is such a man a superior man? He is a superior man indeed."

passages.zh: 曾子曰：「士不可以不弘毅，任重而道遠。
passages.en: The philosopher Zeng said, "The officer may not be without breadth of mind and vigorous endurance. His burden is heavy and his course is long.

passages.zh: 仁以為己任，不亦重乎？
passages.en: Perfect virtue is the burden which he considers it is his to sustain - is it not heavy?

passages.zh: 死而後已，不亦遠乎？」
passages.en: Only with death does his course stop - is it not long?"

passages.zh: 子曰：「興於詩，立於禮。
passages.en: The Master said, "It is by the Odes that the mind is aroused. It is by the Rules of Propriety that the character is established.

passages.zh: 成於樂。」
passages.en: It is from Music that the finish is received."

passages.zh: 子曰：「民可使由之，不可使知之。」
passages.en: The Master said, "The people may be made to follow a path of action, but they may not be made to understand it."

passages.zh: 子曰：「好勇疾貧，亂也。
passages.en: The Master said, "The man who is fond of daring and is dissatisfied with poverty, will proceed to insubordination.

passages.zh: 人而不仁，疾之已甚，亂也。」
passages.en: The man who is not virtuous, when you carry your dislike of him to an extreme, will also proceed to insubordination."

passages.zh: 子曰：「如有周公之才之美，使驕且吝，其餘不足觀也已。」
passages.en: The Master said, "Though a man have abilities as admirable as those of the duke of Zhou, yet if he be proud and niggardly, those other things are really not worth being looked at."

passages.zh: 子曰：「三年學，不至於穀，不易得也。」
passages.en: The Master said, "Having learned for three years without coming to be good - such a man is not easy to find."

passages.zh: 子曰：「篤信好學，守死善道。
passages.en: The Master said, "With sincere faith he unites the love of learning; holding firm to death, he is perfecting the excellence of his course.

passages.zh: 危邦不入，亂邦不居。
passages.en: Such a one will not enter a tottering state, nor dwell in a disorganized one.

passages.zh: 天下有道則見，無道則隱。
passages.en: When right principles of government prevail in the kingdom, he will show himself; when they are prostrated, he will keep concealed.

passages.zh: 邦有道，貧且賤焉，恥也；
passages.en: When a country is well governed, poverty and a mean condition are things to be ashamed of.

passages.zh: 邦無道，富且貴焉，恥也。」
passages.en: When a country is ill governed, riches and honor are things to be ashamed of."

passages.zh: 子曰：「不在其位，不謀其政。」
passages.en: The Master said, "He who is not in any particular office has nothing to do with plans for the administration of its duties."

passages.zh: 子曰：「師摯之始，關雎之亂，洋洋乎！盈耳哉。」
passages.en: The Master said, "When the music master Zhi first entered on his office, the finish of the Guan Ju was magnificent - how it filled the ears!"

passages.zh: 子曰：「狂而不直，侗而不愿，悾悾而不信，吾不知之矣。」
passages.en: The Master said, "Ardent and yet not upright, stupid and yet not attentive; simple and yet not sincere - such persons I do not understand."

passages.zh: 子曰：「學如不及，猶恐失之。」
passages.en: The Master said, "Learn as if you could not reach your object, and were always fearing also lest you should lose it."

passages.zh: 子曰：「巍巍乎！舜禹之有天下也，而不與焉。」
passages.en: The Master said, "How majestic was the manner in which Shun and Yu held possession of the empire, as if it were nothing to them!"

passages.zh: 子曰：「大哉，堯之為君也！
passages.en: The Master said, "Great indeed was Yao as a sovereign!

passages.zh: 巍巍乎！唯天為大，唯堯則之。
passages.en: How majestic was he! It is only Heaven that is grand, and only Yao corresponded to it.

passages.zh: 蕩蕩乎！民無能名焉。
passages.en: How vast was his virtue! The people could find no name for it.

passages.zh: 巍巍乎！其有成功也；
passages.en: How majestic was he in the works which he accomplished!

passages.zh: 煥乎，其有文章！」
passages.en: How glorious in the elegant regulations which he instituted!"

passages.zh: 舜有臣五人而天下治。
passages.en: Shun had five ministers, and the empire was well governed.

passages.zh: 武王曰：「予有亂臣十人。」
passages.en: King Wu said, "I have ten able ministers."

passages.zh: 孔子曰：「才難，不其然乎？
passages.en: Confucius said, "Is not the saying that talents are difficult to find, true?

passages.zh: 唐虞之際，於斯為盛。
passages.en: Only when the dynasties of Tang and Yu met, were they more abundant than in this of Zhou,

passages.zh: 有婦人焉，九人而已。
passages.en: yet there was a woman among them. The able ministers were no more than nine men.

passages.zh: 三分天下有其二，以服事殷。
passages.en: King Wen possessed two of the three parts of the empire, and with those he served the dynasty of Yin.

passages.zh: 周之德，其可謂至德也已矣。」
passages.en: The virtue of the house of Zhou may be said to have reached the highest point indeed."

passages.zh: 子曰：「禹，吾無間然矣。
passages.en: The Master said, "I can find no flaw in the character of Yu.

passages.zh: 菲飲食，而致孝乎鬼神；
passages.en: He used himself coarse food and drink, but displayed the utmost filial piety towards the spirits.

passages.zh: 惡衣服，而致美乎黻冕；
passages.en: His ordinary garments were poor, but he displayed the utmost elegance in his sacrificial cap and apron.

passages.zh: 卑宮室，而盡力乎溝洫。
passages.en: He lived in a low, mean house, but expended all his strength on the ditches and water channels.

passages.zh: 禹，吾無間然矣。」
passages.en: I can find nothing like a flaw in Yu."

passages.zh: 子罕言利，與命，與仁。
passages.en: The subjects of which the Master seldom spoke were: profitableness, and also the appointments of Heaven, and perfect virtue.

passages.zh: 達巷黨人曰：「大哉孔子！博學而無所成名。」
passages.en: A man of the village of Da Xiang said, "Great indeed is the philosopher Kong! His learning is extensive, and yet he does not render his name famous by any particular thing."

passages.zh: 子聞之，謂門弟子曰：「吾何執？執御乎？執射乎？吾執御矣。」
passages.en: The Master heard the observation, and said to his disciples, "What shall I practice? Shall I practice charioteering, or shall I practice archery? I will practice charioteering."

passages.zh: 子曰：「麻冕，禮也；今也純，儉。吾從眾。
passages.en: The Master said, "The linen cap is that prescribed by the rules of ceremony, but now a silk one is worn. It is economical, and I follow the common practice.

passages.zh: 拜下，禮也；今拜乎上，泰也。雖違眾，吾從下。」
passages.en: Bowing below the hall is prescribed by the rules of ceremony, but now the practice is to bow only after ascending it. That is arrogant. I continue to bow below the hall, though I oppose the common practice."

passages.zh: 子絕四：毋意，毋必，毋固，毋我。
passages.en: There were four things from which the Master was entirely free. He had no foregone conclusions, no arbitrary predeterminations, no obstinacy, and no egoism.

passages.zh: 子畏於匡。
passages.en: The Master was put in fear in Kuang.

passages.zh: 曰：「文王既沒，文不在茲乎？
passages.en: He said, "After the death of King Wen, was not the cause of truth lodged here in me?

passages.zh: 天之將喪斯文也，後死者不得與於斯文也；
passages.en: If Heaven had wished to let this cause of truth perish, then I, a future mortal, should not have got such a relation to that cause.

passages.zh: 天之未喪斯文也，匡人其如予何？」
passages.en: While Heaven does not let the cause of truth perish, what can the people of Kuang do to me?"

passages.zh: 大宰問於子貢曰：「夫子聖者與？何其多能也？」
passages.en: A high officer asked Zi Gong, saying, "May we not say that your Master is a sage? How various is his ability!"

passages.zh: 子貢曰：「固天縱之將聖，又多能也。」
passages.en: Zi Gong said, "Certainly Heaven has endowed him unlimitedly. He is about a sage. And, moreover, his ability is various."

passages.zh: 子聞之，曰：「大宰知我乎！吾少也賤，故多能鄙事。
passages.en: The Master heard of the conversation and said, "Does the high officer know me? When I was young, my condition was low, and therefore I acquired my ability in many things, but they were mean matters.

passages.zh: 君子多乎哉？不多也。」
passages.en: Must the superior man have such variety of ability? He does not need variety of ability."

passages.zh: 牢曰：「子云，『吾不試，故藝』。」
passages.en: Lao said, "The Master said, 'Having no official employment, I acquired many arts.'"

passages.zh: 子曰：「吾有知乎哉？無知也。
passages.en: The Master said, "Am I indeed possessed of knowledge? I am not knowing.

passages.zh: 有鄙夫問於我，空空如也，我叩其兩端而竭焉。」
passages.en: But if a mean person, who appears quite empty-like, ask anything of me, I set it forth from one end to the other, and exhaust it."

passages.zh: 子曰：「鳳鳥不至，河不出圖，吾已矣夫！」
passages.en: The Master said, "The Feng bird does not come; the river sends forth no map - it is all over with me!"

passages.zh: 子見齊衰者、冕衣裳者與瞽者，見之，雖少必作；
passages.en: When the Master saw a person in a mourning dress, or any one with the cap and upper and lower garments of full dress, or a blind person, on observing them approaching, though they were younger than himself, he would rise up,

passages.zh: 過之，必趨。
passages.en: and if he had to pass by them, he would do so hastily.

passages.zh: 顏淵喟然歎曰：「仰之彌高，鑽之彌堅；
passages.en: Yan Yuan, in admiration of the Master's doctrines, sighed and said, "I looked up to them, and they seemed to become more high; I tried to penetrate them, and they seemed to become more firm;

passages.zh: 瞻之在前，忽焉在後。
passages.en: I looked at them before me, and suddenly they seemed to be behind.

passages.zh: 夫子循循然善誘人，博我以文，約我以禮。
passages.en: The Master, by orderly method, skillfully leads men on. He enlarged my mind with learning, and taught me the restraints of propriety.

passages.zh: 欲罷不能，既竭吾才，如有所立卓爾。
passages.en: When I wish to give over the study of his doctrines, I cannot do so, and having exerted all my ability, there seems something to stand right up before me;

passages.zh: 雖欲從之，末由也已。」
passages.en: but though I wish to follow and lay hold of it, I really find no way to do so."

passages.zh: 子疾病，子路使門人為臣。
passages.en: The Master being very ill, Zi Lu wished the disciples to act as ministers to him.

passages.zh: 病閒，曰：「久矣哉！由之行詐也，無臣而為有臣。
passages.en: During a remission of his illness, he said, "Long has the conduct of You been deceitful! By pretending to have ministers when I have them not, whom should I impose upon?

passages.zh: 吾誰欺？欺天乎？
passages.en: Should I impose upon Heaven?

passages.zh: 且予與其死於臣之手也，無寧死於二三子之手乎？
passages.en: Moreover, than that I should die in the hands of ministers, is it not better that I should die in the hands of you, my disciples?

passages.zh: 且予縱不得大葬，予死於道路乎？」
passages.en: And though I may not get a great burial, shall I die upon the road?"

passages.zh: 子貢曰：「有美玉於斯，韞匵而藏諸？求善賈而沽諸？」
passages.en: Zi Gong said, "There is a beautiful gem here. Should I lay it up in a case and keep it? or should I seek for a good price and sell it?"

passages.zh: 子曰：「沽之哉！沽之哉！我待賈者也。」
passages.en: The Master said, "Sell it! Sell it! But I would wait for one to offer the price."

passages.zh: 子欲居九夷。
passages.en: The Master was wishing to go and live among the nine wild tribes of the east.

passages.zh: 或曰：「陋，如之何！」
passages.en: Some one said, "They are rude. How can you do such a thing?"

passages.zh: 子曰：「君子居之，何陋之有？」
passages.en: The Master said, "If a superior man dwelt among them, what rudeness would there be?"

passages.zh: 子曰：「吾自衛反魯，然後樂正，雅頌各得其所。」
passages.en: The Master said, "I returned from Wei to Lu, and then the music was reformed, and the pieces in the Royal songs and Praise songs all found their proper places."

passages.zh: 子曰：「出則事公卿，入則事父兄，喪事不敢不勉，不為酒困，何有於我哉？」
passages.en: The Master said, "Abroad, to serve the high ministers and nobles; at home, to serve one's father and elder brothers; in all duties to the dead, not to dare not to exert one's self; and not to be overcome of wine - which one of these things do I attain to?"

passages.zh: 子在川上，曰：「逝者如斯夫！不舍晝夜。」
passages.en: The Master standing by a stream, said, "It passes on just like this, not ceasing day or night!"

passages.zh: 子曰：「吾未見好德如好色者也。」
passages.en: The Master said, "I have not seen one who loves virtue as he loves beauty."

passages.zh: 子曰：「譬如為山，未成一簣，止，吾止也；
passages.en: The Master said, "The prosecution of learning may be compared to what may happen in raising a mound. If there want but one basket of earth to complete the work, and I stop, the stopping is my own work.

passages.zh: 譬如平地，雖覆一簣，進，吾往也。」
passages.en: It may be compared to throwing down the earth on the level ground. Though but one basketful is thrown at a time, the advancing with it is my own going forward."

passages.zh: 子曰：「語之而不惰者，其回也與！」
passages.en: The Master said, "Never flagging when I set forth anything to him - ah! that is Hui."

passages.zh: 子謂顏淵，曰：「惜乎！吾見其進也，未見其止也。」
passages.en: The Master said of Yan Yuan, "Alas! I saw his constant advance. I never saw him stop in his progress."

passages.zh: 子曰：「苗而不秀者有矣夫！
passages.en: The Master said, "There are cases in which the blade springs, but the plant does not go on to flower!

passages.zh: 秀而不實者有矣夫！」
passages.en: There are cases where it flowers but no fruit is subsequently produced!"

passages.zh: 子曰：「後生可畏，焉知來者之不如今也？
passages.en: The Master said, "A youth is to be regarded with respect. How do we know that his future will not be equal to our present?

passages.zh: 四十、五十而無聞焉，斯亦不足畏也已。」
passages.en: If he reach the age of forty or fifty, and has not made himself heard of, then indeed he will not be worth being regarded with respect."

passages.zh: 子曰：「法語之言，能無從乎？改之為貴。
passages.en: The Master said, "Can men refuse to assent to the words of strict admonition? But it is reforming the conduct because of them which is valuable.

passages.zh: 巽與之言，能無說乎？繹之為貴。
passages.en: Can men refuse to be pleased with words of gentle advice? But it is unfolding their aim which is valuable.

passages.zh: 說而不繹，從而不改，吾末如之何也已矣。」
passages.en: If a man be pleased with these words, but does not unfold their aim, and assents to those, but does not reform his conduct, I can really do nothing with him."

passages.zh: 子曰：「主忠信，毋友不如己者，過則勿憚改。」
passages.en: The Master said, "Hold faithfulness and sincerity as first principles. Have no friends not equal to yourself. When you have faults, do not fear to abandon them."

passages.zh: 子曰：「三軍可奪帥也，匹夫不可奪志也。」
passages.en: The Master said, "The commander of the forces of a large state may be carried off, but the will of even a common man cannot be taken from him."

passages.zh: 子曰：「衣敝縕袍，與衣狐貉者立，而不恥者，其由也與？
passages.en: The Master said, "Dressed himself in a tattered robe quilted with hemp, yet standing by the side of men dressed in furs, and not ashamed - ah! it is You who is equal to this!

passages.zh: 『不忮不求，何用不臧？』」
passages.en: He dislikes none, he covets nothing - what can he do but what is good!"

passages.zh: 子路終身誦之。
passages.en: Zi Lu kept continually repeating these words of the ode,

passages.zh: 子曰：「是道也，何足以臧？」
passages.en: when the Master said, "Those things are by no means sufficient to constitute perfect excellence."

passages.zh: 子曰：「歲寒，然後知松柏之後彫也。」
passages.en: The Master said, "When the year becomes cold, then we know how the pine and the cypress are the last to lose their leaves."

passages.zh: 子曰：「知者不惑，仁者不憂，勇者不懼。」
passages.en: The Master said, "The wise are free from perplexities; the virtuous from anxiety; and the bold from fear."

passages.zh: 子曰：「可與共學，未可與適道；
passages.en: The Master said, "There are some with whom we may study in common, but we shall find them unable to go along with us to principles.

passages.zh: 可與適道，未可與立；
